title.narrative: Second Support to the Education Sector Project PASEN II

description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to: (a) improve the students' retention rate in Primary Education Schools located in Participating Municipalities; and (b) strengthen MINED’s education management capacity.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Operational Manual for the Additional Financing | Description :The Recipient shall update, adopt and thereaftercarry out the Project in accordance with an operational manual (the Operational Manual), satisfactory to the Association. | DueDate:15-Sep-2016

Finance Agreement :Project Coordinator | Description :Appoint and maintain at all times during Project implementation a Projectcoordinator within MINED, with functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Safeguards | Description :The Recipient, through MINED, shall carry out the Project in accordance with theIndigenous Peoples Development Plan. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, Sub-Section A.1.(b) | Description :Finance Agreement: Full-Time Support Staff |Description: Not later than 45 days after the Effective Date, appoint and, thereafter, maintain, at all times during Projectimplementation, competent personnel required for Project implementation, in adequate numbers and with sufficient resources,including, but not limited to, a senior international procurement advisor, a procurement coordinator, a fi | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, Sub-Section A.1 | Description :Finance Agreement: Reporting Requirements | Description:The Recipient shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project and prepare Project Reports in accordance with the provisionsof Section 4.08 of the General Conditions and on the basis of the indicators acceptable to the Association. Each Project Reportshall cover the period of one semester, and shall be furnished to the Association no | Frequency :SemiAnnual

title.narrative: Number of primary schools in targeted municipalities adequately equipped with furniture, under the Project
Graduates from the multi-grade pre-service teacher training program who teach for at least one year in targeted areas under the Project
Official annual statistical reports published under the Project
1st- and 2nd-grade students that receive ESAEDI textbooks in targeted municipalities
Classrooms in targeted areas offering the pilot of accelerated primary school program under the Project.
Teacher trainees enrolled in the multi-grade pre-service training program under the Project
Pre-investment infrastructure studies developed under the Project
Students in targeted municipalites that receive Paquetes Solidarios
Teachers who participate in dissemination events of national learning assessment results under the Project.
Development and use by MINED of the new school infrastructure inventory system
Average number of primary education teachers from targeted municipalities that participate in TEPCEs during a given school year, under the Project
Books distributed in the SEAR under the Project
Percentage of parents that agree or mostly agree with the statement ?The Paquete Solidario (school kit) was a key reason why I was able to keep my child at school this year?
Utility of the learning assessment system
Survival rate through 4th grade in targeted municipalities
Primary school students with a Math textbook
Survival rate through 2nd grade in targeted municipalities
Survival rate through 3rd grade in targeted municipalities
Primary school students with a language textbook and a math textbook
Primary school students with a Language & Literature textbook
Within-year retention rate for grade 1 in targeted municipalities
Within-year retention rate for primary education in targeted municipalities
Within-year retention rate for grade 2 in targeted municipalities
Systematization of Multi-Grade Modality officially published by MINED
Assessments repeated at least once every 5 years for the same subject areas and grades
Data reported by gender, urban/rural geographical locations
System for learning assessment at the primary level
